posts.cooked:
Hi everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.76.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • Set up custom notification profiles to control which people and groups you receive notifications from when that profile is enabled. Create a “Work” profile that keeps non-coworkers at bay (with an exception for your bae) and a “Downtime” profile that doesn’t include your boss. You can switch between notification profiles whenever you want, or configure a schedule so it happens automatically.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.75.0-beta.1…v7.76.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.75 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.76.0-beta.1

55 new commits since 7.75.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.76.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Don't include Server.js in Interface.js [2]

  • Avoid deadlock when processing deletes and edits concurrently [3]

  • Fix typo in unblock group modal [4]

  • Simplify source file dependency graph [5]

  • Reproduce linux build with github action [6]

  • Avoid regenerating thumbnail or screenshot on edit [7]

  • Centralize message attachment file path logic [8]

  • Revert Linux GTK version workaround [9]

  • Add script for linux build targets [10]

  • Update to libsignal 0.83.0, remove passed-in requests for SPQR (now on by default) [11]

  • Init AxoMenuBuilder [12]

  • Update pnpm to 10.18.1 [13]

  • Bump electron from 38.2.0 to 38.2.1 [14]

  • Resolve flakiness in calling mock test [15]

  • Faster incremental builds [16]

  • Fix duplicate all chats folder [17]

  • Fallback to emoji-datasource for unlocalized emoji [18]

  • Move SignalProtocolStore off window [19]

  • Fix emojification of release note [20]

  • Remove old emoji and sticker pickers [21]

  • Support for Notification Profiles [22]

  • Remove donations flags [23]

  • MessageDetail: Increase padding between label and value [24]

  • release notes [25]

  • Update strings [26]

  • Update DNS fallback [27]

  • Improve typing indicator sending/receiving behavior [28]

  • Make verified notifications consistent [29]

  • Remove window.textsecure global [30]

  • Remove window.Signal.Services.storage [31]

  • Log when we clear profile name [32]

  • Remove a bunch more global variables [33]

  • safePoll shouldn't produce error messages [34]

  • Use mp4san [35]

  • Remove window.i18n in favor of SignalContext.i18n [36]

  • Add extra calling error modal [37]

  • Remove window.Signal.Migrations [38]

  • Remove window.getAccountManager [39]

  • Chat folders bugfixes & ui updates [40]

  • Improve attachment handling of edits [41]

  • Fix calling dev tools window [42]

  • Update emoji search index to version 15 [43]

  • Re-use standard attachments on edit [44]

  • Fix context menu trigger on chat folders overview [45]

  • Refine signal connections definition [46]

  • Linux: Fix StartupWMClass to fix app icon [47]

  • Refactor backup subscription UI [48]

  • Setup dependabot for github-actions [49]

  • Fix typo in notification profiles setting [50]

  • Linux: Fix X11 app icon by updating desktopName and wm_class [51]

  • Fix Linux wm class for alpha [52]

  • Release notes for 7.76 [53]

  • Update strings [54]

  • 7.76.0-beta.1 [55]

posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked:
Hello!

When you updated your local copy - did you run pnpm generate ? It should update the expiration timestamps in config/local-production.json.

posts.name: jesse james johnson
posts.cooked:
I’ve noticed the Signal (7.76.0-beta.1) for macOS is only displaying chats within the Chats tab from the first Chat folder I have set on my mobile device. Since the desktop client doesn’t currently support Chat folders, it might make sense to default the desktop chat tab to the “All chats” view until the desktop client supports Chat folders.

The behavior can be replicated by changing the order of the chat folders in the mobile app and then restarting the desktop client, the desk client will then filter the chat tab to the first folder selected in the chat settings.

Otherwise if I’m missing a setting which lets me change the Chat folder on the chat tab in the desktop app then I’m having trouble finding it.

posts.name: zetam
posts.cooked:
pnpm run generate
cp -a release/linux-arm64-unpacked ~/.local/lib/Signal-Desktop
ln -s ~/.local/lib/Signal-Desktop/signal-desktop ~/bin/

like a charm ;)

thank you very much

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
All of my notification profiles are duplicated on Desktop.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.76.0-beta.1/57e0bf6388713a7d04f5bc464819d449510ab72bd36fea57e70ab29d1729e2d3.gz

Super glad to see this feature make it to Desktop :)

I am experiencing this too, but on stable! I just updated to 7.75.0, and I’m also only seeing the chats from the first Chat folder set on my mobile device. I was so confused. I am able to see my unread messages when I filter for them, and I can still find my chats, but they disappear from the list after going to another chat (probably because they are not a part of that first folder). Hopefully this can be dealt with.

New Version: 7.76.0-beta.2

2 new commits since 7.76.0-beta.1:

  • Disable chat folder filtering when feature is disabled [1]

  • 7.76.0-beta.2 [2]

posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked:
Hey @Whatnoww, sorry to hear about those duplicates. From your log, I see that seven notification profiles were created from storage service, and then later the active profile was updated:

INFO  2025-10-16T12:22:38.605Z [storage] merge(30089:F/O): merged item type=9 oldID=? shouldDrop=false details=[“created new notification profile”]
INFO  2025-10-16T12:22:38.606Z [storage] merge(30089:XJs): merged item type=9 oldID=? shouldDrop=false details=[“created new notification profile”]
INFO  2025-10-16T12:22:38.607Z [storage] merge(30089:VWv): merged item type=9 oldID=? shouldDrop=false details=[“created new notification profile”]
INFO  2025-10-16T12:22:38.608Z [storage] merge(30089:GwK): merged item type=9 oldID=? shouldDrop=false details=[“created new notification profile”]
INFO  2025-10-16T12:22:38.609Z [storage] merge(30089:maH): merged item type=9 oldID=? shouldDrop=false details=[“created new notification profile”]
INFO  2025-10-16T12:22:38.610Z [storage] merge(30089:SwI): merged item type=9 oldID=? shouldDrop=false details=[“created new notification profile”]
INFO  2025-10-16T12:22:38.611Z [storage] merge(30089:677): merged item type=9 oldID=? shouldDrop=false details=[“created new notification profile”]

...

INFO  2025-10-16T12:22:39.610Z [notificationProfilesService] notificationProfileService: starting
INFO  2025-10-16T12:22:39.610Z [notificationProfilesService] notificationProfileService: finding next profile event
INFO  2025-10-16T12:22:39.610Z [notificationProfilesService] notificationProfileService: next profile event has changed, updating redux
INFO  2025-10-16T12:22:39.611Z [notificationProfilesService] notificationProfileService: next check 2025-10-16T17:59:00.000Z; waiting 20180389ms

What do you see in the app? 14 total? Or are the set of duplicates within this set of seven?

Feel free to reach out to me directly; I’d like to get into the details on this.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Sent you a DM :)

Additionally, desktop seems to be no longer sending to the contact I removed, so thanks for the fix!

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: I’ve encountered some behavior that is inconsistent with Android and iOS. When a user leaves a group, their profile name is not white/greyed-out like it is on the mobile platforms, so it’s confusing since you may reply to the user believing they are still part of the group. If you’ve missed their leave alert you’ll never realize.

image970×115 15.8 KB

image980×112 13.3 KB

This is not true. The messages are not very large, but very short.

But BOTH of them cited a very large message. Maybe something is being confused here.

And: This is from a paid online backup restored to a new phone and then syncronized to Signal desktop. Maybe it has something to do with that?

I can send you the messages privately, if you want to reproduce and debug.

The messages also are wrong (but differently) on Signal Android. See Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.61 release - #21 by erik55

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.61 release

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
I’m getting consistent lock ups on Signal Desktop. Mind you my system is not bottle-necking performance (or at least it shouldn’t). But it’s becoming unbearable to have it lock up every time I scroll.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.76.0-beta.2/287b4d5f065b56544f2f53fba8a7c1aa37e703344c0f2c0111b4216ef829ab64.gz

posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked:
@Whatnoww What is happening to your computer’s resources during these lockups? Is it high CPU usage, high memory usage, or maybe nothing happening at all?

And for that log you provided, can you give us some rough timestamps for lockups to give us somewhere to start?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Basically nothing at all. I’ve been monitoring resource usage (i7-14700K rtx5080 on idle), nothing happens, it just locks up when scrolling, no spikes on data read/writes, ram is 64GB, even on Windows I don’t think Signal would use anywhere close to it, so I’m unsure.

When I scroll it’ll just lock my scroll. When I get a chance to reproduce I’ll grab some timestamps

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.77 release.
